sections.heading: UNLAWFUL RE-ENTRY OF LAND AFTER OUSTER
sections.text:
18-3502. UNLAWFUL RE-ENTRY OF LAND AFTER OUSTER. Every person who has been removed from any lands by process of law, or who has removed from any lands pursuant to the lawful adjudication or direction of any court, tribunal or officer, and who afterward unlawfully returns to settle, reside upon or take possession of such lands, is guilty of a misdemeanor.

[18-3502, added 1972, ch. 336, sec. 1, p. 916.]
